title: Understanding Date Filtering
text: In SQL, to filter records based on a date, you can use the WHERE clause with a comparison operator. Ensure the date is in the correct format, typically 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

title: Combining Conditions
text: To apply multiple conditions in SQL, use the AND or OR operators. AND requires both conditions to be true, while OR requires at least one condition to be true.

title: Constructing the SQL Query
text: Write the SQL query to select records where the 'OrderDate' is after March $$15$$, $$2020$$, and the 'TotalPrice' is less than $500.

title: Using the DATE Function
text: The DATE function in SQL is used to extract the date part from a datetime expression. This can be useful when comparing dates.
